citations.narrative:
The Licensee does not maintain complete medical records for all adult dogs. Records indicate that 6 adult dogs have no
vaccination history:
- Adult F Yorkie #1975, Adult F Pomeranian # 4410, Adult F Pomeranian #6319, Adult F Maltese #0179, Adult F Shih Tzu
#6244, and Adult F Shih Tzu #9271.
The licensee states that the animals are up to date for these vaccines but they did not record that information in the
medical record. Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine
if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the
names of all vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments
given and ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 12-DEC-2024.

The Licensee was unable to provide documentation of heartworm tests performed. The Licensee stated that heartworm
tests were performed on all adult dogs in April 2024 but could not provide the test results. Failure to document testing
results may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care.
Medical records must be maintained and include the dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or other required
or recommended test or examination. Correct by documenting the results of all testing and ensure that medical records
are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 12-DEC-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
n

narrative:
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The Licensee does not maintain complete medical records for all adult dogs. Records indicate that 6 adult dogs have no 
vaccination history: 
 
- Adult F Yorkie #1975, Adult F Pomeranian # 4410, Adult F Pomeranian #6319, Adult F Maltese #0179, Adult F Shih Tzu 
#6244, and Adult F Shih Tzu #9271. 
 
The licensee states that the animals are up to date for these vaccines but they did not record that information in the 
medical record. Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine 
if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the 
names of all vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments 
given and ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 12-DEC-2024. 
3.13(b)(4) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The Licensee was unable to provide documentation of heartworm tests performed. The Licensee stated that heartworm 
tests were performed on all adult dogs in April 2024 but could not provide the test results. Failure to document testing 
results may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals are receiving adequate veterinary care. 
Medical records must be maintained and include the dates and findings/results of all screening, routine, or other required 
or recommended test or examination. Correct by documenting the results of all testing and ensure that medical records 
are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 12-DEC-2024. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Licensee.
